intro: Adamia stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. Adamia stenocarpa is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
